feature.name: Starting Proficiencies
feature.text: You are proficient with the following items, in addition to any proficiencies provided by your race or background.
Armor: light armor, medium armor
Weapons: simple weapons
Tools: one type of artisan's tools
Skills: Choose 3 from Arcana, History, Insight, Intimidation, Investigation, Medicine and Perception

feature.name: Starting Equipment
feature.text: You begin play with the following equipment, in addition to any equipment provided by your background.
• Light Crossbow with 20 bolts and a simple weapon
• Scale Mail or any light armor
• One type of Artisan’s Tools and a simple weapon
• Component Pouch and a schematics binder
• Dungeoneer’s pack or a scholar’s pack
Alternatively, you may start with 5d4x10 gp and choose your own equipment.

feature.name: Spellcrafting
feature.text: As an artificer, you cannot directly cast spells (other than cantrips), but instead use objects, scrolls and potions as a medium to replicate effects of spells known as schematics (see below).
Object Dependence:

When you cast an artificer cantrip, a ritual, or schematic from a schematics binder that has a duration longer than instantaneous, targets of the schematic must hold or wear one of its material components to benefit from the schematic. Schematics that target constructs use their body for this component.
Cantrips:
You know the Mending, Light, and Prestidigitation cantrips.
Schematics Binder:

You have a schematics binder, which contains magical blueprints related to linking magic to objects. At first level it contains detect magic, identify, and three 1st level spells from any class. You can activate or create magic items as if you were a spellcaster whose spell list includes the contents of your schematics binder. Schematic types are Potion Schematic, Spell Schematic, and Item Schematic.
Ritual Caster:
If a spell schematic in your binder has the Ritual tag, you can cast it as a ritual without using a spell slot.
Spellcrafting Ability:

Intelligence is your ability for artificer infusions and spellcrafting, as you have to reverse-engineer and hack together an improvised version of a spell (spell schematic) instead of casting it. Whenever you create a magical effect from a schematic or cast an infusion, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC and spell attack roll:
Saving Throw DC = 8+Your proficiency bonus+your Intelligence modifier
Spell Attack Modifier = Your proficiency bonus+your Intelligence modifier
Acquiring schematics of 1st level and higher:

Every time you gain an artificer level, you choose one new spell of at least 1st level from any class's list and add it as a schematic in your schematics binder. You can also add a spell you find to your binder, similar to the Spellbook sidebar (PHB page 114) but they are added as schematics instead. Schematics employ a different formulation than spells in spellbooks or ritual books, so a spellbook cannot supply a schematic and vice versa; however, other schematics, spell scrolls, and certain other magical writings can supply the appropriate information. You cannot learn a spell schematic of any level higher than the level specified in the Artificer table.
You can learn 2nd level spell schematics at 5th level, 3rd at 8th, 4th at 11th, 5th at 14th, 6th at 17th, and 7th at 20th.

feature.name: Craft Reserve
feature.text: When another class feature of yours creates a temporary magical object, its magic is sustained by your craft reserve. Your craft reserve is equal to your artificer level plus your Intelligence modifier. Spent craft reserve recovers after the item it was spent to create is no longer magical and you finish a long rest, unless otherwise mentioned.

feature.name: Concoct Potions
feature.text: As part of a short rest, if you have a vial of water and a component pouch available, spend one or more points of craft reserve to create one magic potion (see below). The type of potions you can create are limited by your artificer level and whether or not it is listed as a potion schematic in your schematics binder. Potions last until consumed or destroyed.
Level — Reserve — Potion Rarity:
1st — 1 — Common
3rd — 2 — Uncommon
6th — 3 — Rare
11th — 2 — Very Rare
17th — 5 — Legendary

feature.name: Write Scroll
feature.text: As part of a short rest, if you have a quill, ink, and a sheet of parchment paper available, you can create one spell scroll of any spell schematic recorded in your schematics binder. Doing so costs you 1 point of craft reserve per level of the spell, and you must supply any components the spell requires. These scrolls remain until used or destroyed and are not restricted by Object Dependence when activating.

feature.name: Exquisite Crafter
feature.text: Choose 1 common magic item and learn its schematic (Potion, Scroll, or Item schematic). You learn this schematic and can use it to craft the specified item in your downtime. For every artificer level gained after 1st, you can gain an additional schematic equal or lower to the rarity specified in the Artificer table.
In addition, all magic items of the rarity specified in the Artificer table that you can create have their base cost to craft cut in half, effectively halving both cost and time to craft.
Starting at 3rd level, you can learn schematics for and craft uncommon items; at 6th, rare items; at 11th, very rare items; and at 17th, legendary items.

feature.name: Infusions
feature.text: You specialize in the practice of creating matter or imbuing objects with magic. Starting at 2nd level, you gain two Infusions of your choice. Your infusions are detailed at the end of the class description. When you gain artificer levels, you gain additional infusions of your choice, as shown in the Infusions Known column of the Artificer table.
You learn an additional infusion at 5th, 8th, 11th, 14th, 17th, and 19th level.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the infusions you know and replace it with another infusion you could learn at that level.

feature.name: Personal Weapon Augmentation
feature.text: While fighting with a weapon under the influence of your Augmentation infusion, you may use your Intelligence modifier on attack and damage rolls. The weapon also deals bonus damage of the chosen type at 5th (+1d4), 11th (+2d4), and 17th (+3d4) level.

feature.name: Infusion: Augmentation
feature.text: As an action, you can infuse a weapon or piece of armor (clothes and shields included) with one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage. If you chose a weapon, it is now a magic weapon which deals damage of that type in place of one of its normal damage types. If you chose a piece of armor, it now gives resistance to that damage type. Only one effect can be used per item at a time and these effects last for 1 hour. You can use this ability number of times equal to your intelligence modifier per long rest.

feature.name: Infusion: Disable Construct
feature.text: As an action, you can infuse damaging energy into a construct. The construct must be within 30 ft of you. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. The target loses 1d8 hit points on a failed save and half damage on a successful one. This amount increases as you level, 2d8 at 5th level, 3d8 at 8th level, 4d8 at 11th level, 5d8 at 14th level, 6d8 at 17th level and 7d8 at 20th level. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your intelligence modifier per long rest.

feature.name: Infusion: Extended Infusion
feature.text: You can double the duration of an effect from an infusion, scroll, potion, or magic item if it has a duration of 1 minute or longer, to a maximum of 24 hours.

feature.name: Infusion: Lubricant
feature.text: You can cast grease at will without expending material components.

feature.name: Infusion: Pending Potion
feature.text: You can administer the effect of a potion you’ve ingested within the last 24 hours as a bonus action instead of at the time of ingestion. Only one potion can be used in this way at a time.

feature.name: Infusion: Reboot
feature.text: As an action, you can touch a dying construct that has 0 hit points. The construct becomes stable and regains one hit point.

feature.name: Infusion: Repair Damage
feature.text: As an action, you can touch a construct to infuse repairing energy into it. The target regains 1d8 hit points. This amount increases as you level, 2d8 at 5th level, 3d8 at 8th level, 4d8 at 11th level, 5d8 at 14th level, 6d8 at 17th level and 7d8 at 20th level. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your intelligence modifier per long rest.

feature.name: Artificer Specialization
feature.text: At 3rd level, you become affiliated with your preferred method of artifice: Battle Engineer, Arcanotechnician or Master Maker. Your choice grants you features when you choose it at 3rd level, and again at 5th, 11th, and 17th levels.

feature.name: Battle Engineer
feature.text: Battle Engineers are the epitome of field testers. They charge into the fray with a freshly crafted Flaming Sword to scorch their enemies. “Who better to use these creations than the creator?” These Artificers prefer martial prowess compared to other artificers.

feature.name: Bonus Proficiencies (Battle Engineer)
feature.text: When you specialize into Battle Engineer at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with martial weapons and shields.

feature.name: Physical Augmentation (Battle Engineer)
feature.text: Also at 3rd level, you learn the Augmentation infusion which does not count against your total number of infusions known. If you already knew this infusion, you learn a different infusion of your choice. In addition, when you use this infusion on a piece of armor or a shield, you can instead choose piercing, bludgeoning or slashing damage as the resisted type.

feature.name: Arcanotechnician
feature.text: Arcanotechnicians always have the right tool for the situation. They hastily create devices for the task at hand, but the quality suffers because of it. These tools have a tendency to backfire or cause other devastating mishaps. The extra versatility comes with the risk of volatility.

feature.name: Inventor (Arcanotechnician)
feature.text: At 3rd level, you can spend one minute creating a Spell Storing Item. Doing so infuses a small object with one spell schematic you know of your choice (you must provide the material components of the chosen schematic while creating the item). At any point within an hour after creation, you can use the item to cast the schematic’s spell; the item takes the place of any components (including verbal and somatic components), but loses its magic after afterwards. Using the item takes your action, or the chosen spell’s casting time, whichever is longer.

Using the item carries a risk of failure. When you use the item, you must succeed on an Intelligence (Arcana) check (DC 10+twice the schematic’s level) to cast the spell. If you fail the check, a mishap occurs instead; by default, this deals 1d6 force damage per level of the schematic to you, but alternative mishaps are possible (see Dungeon Master's Guide p.140 for a partial list of ideas).
You can only have one Spell Storing Item at any given time.

feature.name: Master Maker
feature.text: Master Makers can create a mechanical helper that aids them inside and out of combat. Given time, they can make adjustments to their homunculus to adapt to the situation. These crafted constructs are a mental extension to the artificer and provides support as needed, similar to a familiar or animal companion.

feature.name: Mechanic (Master Maker)
feature.text: At 3rd level, you learn the Repair Damage infusion which does not count against your total number of infusions known. If you already knew this infusion, you learn a different infusion of your choice.

feature.name: Craft Homunculus (Master Maker)
feature.text: At 3rd level, over one week of downtime, you can create a homunculus to aid you in adventuring. Add your proficiency bonus to its AC, attack rolls, damage rolls, and skill proficiencies. Its hit point maximum equals your artificer level times four. Commanding the homunculus telepathically is a bonus action. If uncommanded during combat, the DM controls it that round; it's loyal but not necessarily brave. Once commanded, it can deliver artificer touch spells for you as if it were a familiar (see the Find Familiar spell). If it is within 100 feet and is holding an arcane device or prototype you created, you can activate the item on the homunculus' behalf as an action (in addition to the bonus action needed to command the homunculus); the homunculus must use its reaction to make any attacks the spell requires. When you spend Hit Dice to recover HP, you can redirect any HP you would recover to the homunculus instead; at the end of any short rest where this happens, it also regains HP equal to your Intelligence modifier. If your homunculus is destroyed, you can construct a replacement with a week of downtime.

feature.name: Ability Score Improvement
feature.text: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

feature.name: Breakthrough (Arcanotechnician)
feature.text: Beginning at 5th level, you can spend a Hit Die while creating Spell Storing Item to create it as an action instead of in 1 minute.

feature.name: Enhanced Repairs (Master Maker)
feature.text: Beginning at 5th level, you add your intelligence modifier to Repair Damage and Disable Construct infusions.

You can cast jump on an object or construct once per short rest without expending material components. A creature wearing an object under this influence of the infusion gains the benefit of the spell.

feature.name: Infusion: Boots of Striding
feature.text: Prerequisite: 8th level

You can cast longstrider on an object or construct once per short rest without expending material components. A creature wearing an object under the influence of this infusion gains the benefit of the spell.

feature.name: Infusion: Buoyancy Boots
feature.text: Prerequisite: 11th level

You can cast water walk on an object or construct once per short rest without expending any material components. A creature wearing on object under the influence of the infusion gains the benefit of the spell. (A use of this infusion can affect multiple targets as per the spell)

feature.name: Infusion: Careful Infusion
feature.text: Prerequisite: 5th level

When an effect from an infusion, scroll, potion, or magic item forces other creatures to make a saving throw, you can protect some of those creatures from the effects full force. Choose a number of those creatures up to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one creature). A chosen creature automatically succeeds on its saving throw against the effect. You can do this an amount of times equal to your Intelligence modifier per long rest.

feature.name: Infusion: Conjure Materials
feature.text: Prerequisite: 14th level
You can cast creation once per long rest.

feature.name: Infusion: Disable Construct
feature.text: As an action, you can infuse damaging energy into a construct. The construct must be within 30 ft of you. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. The target loses 1d8 hit points on a failed save and half damage on a successful one. This amount increases as you level, 2d8 at 5th level, 3d8 at 8th level, 4d8 at 11th level, 5d8 at 14th level, 6d8 at 17th level and 7d8 at 20th level. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your intelligence modifier per long rest.

feature.name: Infusion: Elemental Infusion
feature.text: Prerequisite: 5th level
You can cast elemental weapon at will. This cast starts at a 3rd level spell slot and increases to a 5th level spell slot at 9th level and then a 7th level spell slot at 13th level.

feature.name: Infusion: Enhance Weapon
feature.text: Prerequisite: 3rd level
You can cast magic weapon at will. This cast starts as a 2nd level spell slot and increases to a 4th level spell slot at 7th level and then a 6th level spell slot at 11th level.

feature.name: Infusion: Extended Infusion
feature.text: You can double the duration of an effect from an infusion, scroll, potion, or magic item if it has a duration of 1 minute or longer, to a maximum of 24 hours.

feature.name: Infusion: Goggles of Detection
feature.text: Prerequisite: 11th level

You can cast see invisibility on an object or construct once per short rest without expending any material components. A creature wearing on object under the influence of the infusion gains the benefit of the spell.

feature.name: Infusion: Heightened Infusion
feature.text: Prerequisite: 5th level

When an effect from an infusion, scroll, potion, or magic item forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist it, you can give one target disadvantage on its first saving throw made against the effect. You can do this once per short rest.

feature.name: Infusion: Helm of Oxygen
feature.text: Prerequisite: 11th level

You can cast water breathing on an object or construct once per short rest without expending any material components. A creature wearing on object under the influence of the infusion gains the benefit of the spell. (A use of this infusion can affect multiple targets as per the spell)

feature.name: Infusion: Improvement
feature.text: Prerequisite: 11th level

You can cast enhance ability on an object or construct once per short rest without expending material components. A creature wearing an object under the influence of this infusion gains the benefit of the spell.

feature.name: Infusion: Lock
feature.text: Prerequisite: 5th level
You can cast arcane lock once per long rest.

feature.name: Infusion: Lubricant
feature.text: You can cast grease at will without expending material components.

feature.name: Infusion: Maximized Infusion
feature.text: Prerequisite: 14th level
When an effect from an infusion, scroll, potion, or magic item causes damage, you can deal maximum damage with that effect. You can do this once per long rest.

feature.name: Infusion: Pending Potion
feature.text: You can administer the effect of a potion you’ve ingested within the last 24 hours as a bonus action instead of at the time of ingestion. Only one potion can be used in this way at a time.

feature.name: Infusion: Power Surge
feature.text: Prerequisite: 5th level

By touching a wand, staff, or rod that has at least one charge, you imbue it with temporary charges equal to your artificer level divided by 5 (rounded down) for one minute. These charges are used before real charges. You can use this ability once per long rest.

feature.name: Infusion: Reboot
feature.text: As an action, you can touch a dying construct that has 0 hit points. The construct becomes stable and regains one hit point.

feature.name: Infusion: Repair Damage
feature.text: As an action, you can touch a construct to infuse repairing energy into it. The target regains 1d8 hit points. This amount increases as you level, 2d8 at 5th level, 3d8 at 8th level, 4d8 at 11th level, 5d8 at 14th level, 6d8 at 17th level and 7d8 at 20th level. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your intelligence modifier per long rest.

feature.name: Infusion: Ring of Feathers
feature.text: Prerequisite: 8th level

You can cast feather fall once per short rest on an object or construct without expending material components. A creature wearing an object under the influence of this infusion gains the benefit of the spell. (A use of this infusion can affect multiple targets as per the spell)

feature.name: Infusion: Transmute
feature.text: Prerequisite: 11th level
You can cast fabricate once per long rest.

feature.name: Infusion: Unlock
feature.text: Prerequisite: 5th level
You can cast knock once per long rest.

feature.name: Infusion: Animate
feature.text: Prerequisite: 14th level
You can cast animate objects once per long rest.

feature.name: Infusion: Armor of Speed
feature.text: Prerequisite: 11th level

You can cast haste on an object or construct once per short rest without expending material components. A creature wearing an object under the influence of this infusion gains the benefit of the spell.

feature.name: Infusion: Augmentation
feature.text: As an action, you can infuse a weapon or piece of armor (clothes and shields included) with one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage. If you chose a weapon, it is now a magic weapon which deals damage of that type in place of one of its normal damage types. If you chose a piece of armor, it now gives resistance to that damage type. Only one effect can be used per item at a time and these effects last for 1 hour. You can use this ability number of times equal to your intelligence modifier per long rest.

monster.name: Arbalester
monster.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1d4 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is instead poisoned for 1d10 minutes and unconscious while poisoned this way.

action.name: Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one creature. Hit: 1d8+2 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is instead poisoned for 1d10 minutes and unconscious while poisoned this way.

trait.name: Telepathic Bond
trait.text: While the Arbalester is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what is senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically.

trait.name: Artificer's Improvements
trait.text: An Arbalester adds its creator's proficiency bonus to its AC, attack rolls, damage rolls, and skill proficiencies, and its maximum hit points are equal to its master's level times four.

trait.name: Integrated Crossbow
trait.text: An Arbalester has an integrated light crossbow, which is as poisonous as its normal bite, and a quiver for 20 bolts, which its master must supply. If adjacent to its master when the master casts a spell that uses their weapon or quiver as a component, the arbalester also benefits from that spell.
